title: BBC Local Live: Leicestershire on Friday 10 February 2017 - BBC News
summary: increase in land rover defender thefts .
ranieri hoping to recreate vardy and marez partnership .
news , sport , travel and weather updates resume at 08:00 monday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's all from leicestershire local live this week - updates will start again on monday at 08:00 .

documents.title: weather : more snow to come
text: remaining cold tonight with a few sleet or snow showers - a widespread frost will also develop .
a minimum temperature of -1c ( 30f ) .
saturday will be another cold , cloudy and breezy day with heavy showers falling as rain , sleet or snow .
a maximum temperature 4c ( 39f ) .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: charity targeted for third time
text: this is the third successful break-in at a loros shop so far this year - the others were in oadby and clarendon park in leicester .
the three combined have cost the charity more than £ 3,000 .
the loros furniture shop on welford road and book shop in clarendon park were also targeted - but thankfully they were n't successful .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: thieves steal charity money
text: loros has said their volunteers have been left `` heart-broken '' by the break in that happened last night .
the thieves caused more than £ 1,000 of damage and got away with a small float from the till .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: charity shop 'ransacked '
text: this is some of the damage caused at loros hos shop in blaby
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: local man speaks out about illness
text: before today robin was in the `` parkinson 's closet '' having only told a few friends , family and work colleagues about his illness .
today he has come to the bbc to go public and talk about his challenge .
robin will row from australia to mauritius along with billy taylor , james plumley and barry hayes .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rower to be parkinson 's 'guinea pig '
text: today i met this man ( the guy on the rowing machine )
he is 45-year-old robin buttery from leicester and in 2015 he was diagnosed with young onset parkinson 's disease .
he 's set himself a huge challenge to row across the indian ocean - along the way he 'll be monitored by university experts to see how his condition is affected .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: businesses fear more fire disruption
text: yesterday 's fire in leicester was the seventh of its kind in the last two years according to the fire service - you 'd imagine this would be quite worrying for other businesses in the area .
the owner of a nearby company that supplies the nhs with products has said he feels `` not very comfortable '' .
he worries another fire could `` badly affect '' business - especially as they keep all their stock on the site .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cricketer gets honour from prince
text: former leicestershire bowler stuart broad has received his mbe from prince charles at buckingham palace .
knighthood next ?
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'you can get so many benefits from it ' # peoplescup
text: england player alex scott `` would 've loved the opportunity to have a competition like this when i was younger '' .
what 's she talking about ?
the fa people 's cup - the country 's biggest free five-a-side competition which gives you the chance to make your way to wembley .
`` when i was younger , playing in a football cage , the dream was always to play at wembley , '' adds scott .
`` the fa people 's cup gives anyone the opportunity to sign up to a local team in your area .
you do n't have to rely on your mates .
`` it 's a chance to meet different people , socialise in different environments .
it 's more than just signing up , you can get so many benefits from it . ''
so what are you waiting for ?
sign up for the fa people 's cup - but hurry as the deadline for entries is the 19 february !

documents.title: man stabbed in leicester
text: a man is in hospital after being stabbed several times on aikman avenue in the new parks area of leicester .
police have said they were called to the street shortly before 17:00 following a report of a fight .
a 19-year-old man is in a critical but stable condition and a cordon is still in place on the road .
five men aged 50 , 35 , 20 , 17 and 16 are in custody .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : snow in leicester
text: watch : snow in leicester

documents.title: fire service try to prevent another empty building fire
text: here are the community fire safety officers who were speaking to businesses in leicester following yesterday 's massive fire
they said they 've been here `` several times '' now and most businesses are educated on preventing fires .
author: Helen McCarthy
BBC Radio Leicester Reporter

documents.title: glenfield hospital march
text: just to remind you - this is happening again tomorrow in leicester
campaigners will march from victoria park to jubilee square in protest over nhs england plans to stop children 's heart surgery procedures at glenfield hospital .
the city council is warning this could cause some travel disruption .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: council feeling positive about speed camera campaign
text: despite confusion over department for transport `` guidelines '' - councillors said say they have great support for their lobbying campaign to get more speed `` management '' cameras .
author: Tim Parker
BBC Radio Leicester Political Reporter

documents.title: significant match for slater
text: mike williams , ellis genge and owen williams , who were all released from international duty this week , make the bench , as does new signing maxime mermoz .
it 's a big day for lock ed slater - he 'll make his 100th league appearance for tigers against gloucester tomorrow .
author: Mike McCarthy
BBC Radio Leicester Sport

documents.title: six nations gaps in tigers team
text: the premiership returns with every side having to make adjustments to cope with six nations absentees .
pat cilliers and jono kitto step into the roles vacated by dan cole and ben youngs respectively .
author: Mike McCarthy
BBC Radio Leicester Sport

documents.title: hs2 route 'not sensible '
text: on hs2 - councillor blunt said the initial route was `` sensible '' and `` an engineering achievement '' .
he said the revised route is not .
author: Tim Parker
BBC Radio Leicester Political Reporter

documents.title: councillor critical of school budget
text: i 'm watching leicestershire county cabinet online - councillor ould said next year 's national funding to county schools is `` completely unacceptable '' .
author: Tim Parker
BBC Radio Leicester Political Reporter

documents.title: rugby : tigers name team
text: here 's the tigers team to face gloucester
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: food friday
text: these are lemon drizzle gin cakes - do n't they look lovely ?
ben jackson has been making them with local baker hazel paterson .
you can see the recipe and listen to them bake here .
author: BBC Radio Leicester

documents.title: afternoon weather update
text: generally cloudy with a few light showers as well that are likely to fall as a mix of wet snow , sleet and rain .
only occasional breaks in the cloud with highs of 3c ( 37f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: watch : potato farmer in leicestershire
text: this is ian bourne 's potato sorting machine in action
he does n't supply to supermarkets - he said this is because he ca n't get the correct skin colour they want .
instead his customers just come from the local community .
well - we might not like our weather most of the time but at least we can grow a good spud .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: no 'crises ' for potato farmer
text: i became a victim of the `` courgette crisis '' yesterday - could n't find one in leicester anywhere .
radio leicester have been to see a local vegetable farmer and find out how how his crops have been .
ian bourne has been growing potatoes near worthington in north west leicestershire for decades .
he has n't had any difficulty in growing this year - he 's actually had a very successful yield of manitou potatoes .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: listen : claudio ranieri 's conversations with mahrez and vardy
text: leicester city boss reveals how he 's trying to rekindle mahrez and vardy 's partnership
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: restaurant rejects enderby waitress with emoji
text: the restaurant chain miller & carter has apologised after rejecting an 18-year-old for a waitress job with a crying emoji .
read the full story here .
author: BBC Newsbeat

documents.title: slimani fitness still in question
text: islam slimani is still not 100 % after up a groin injury during the african cup of nations .
ranieri said he will assess him and look at him in training today and tomorrow .
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: young gray is 'growing up '
text: ranieri then began singing the praises of demarai gray who scored this magical goal against derby on wednesday
the foxes boss said he 's `` grown up very well this season '' and he expects a lot from him .
he also called the 20-year-old a `` very good player '' .
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: family 'shattered ' after cyclist death
text: the family of a canadian woman , who was killed when she was hit by a car while cycling , have said they have been left `` shattered '' by her `` untimely '' death .
victoria gayle , 25 , died in hospital after muhammad javid , 20 , of evington road , leicester , drove into her on 6 june .
javid , who was described at leicester crown court as driving like a `` boy racer '' , was detained for 20 months , on thursday .
victoria 's mother carol gayle said : victoria 's death has shattered the entire family , friends and community .
we are all devastated and still struggling to come to terms with her untimely death . ''
author: Neil Heath
BBC News Online

documents.title: ulloa wont feature in swansea match
text: claudio ranieri starts his press conference by talking about who is available to play against swansea .
he said : i want to check today and tomorrow but i think everyone could be available . ''
not leonardo ulloa though .
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: fire service offer safety advice
text: leicestershire fire and rescue service are in leicester today offering commercial fire safety advice .
it follows the large fire yesterday behind st margaret 's church
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: children introduced to the option of university
text: children from holy cross catholic primary school in aylestone were invited by the university in the hope that they might aspire to apply one day .

nicola lumb from the university of leicester said : `` we want them to be able to reach their full potential and a lot of them do n't have the backgrounds that have the support at home so our job is to open their eyes and show them what university is all about . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : delays on narborough road
text: there 's a lane blocked on narborough road heading towards the city through the fullhurst avenue junction

documents.title: hot breakfast ahead of hot match
text: bacon cobs to fill claudio 's tummy ahead of the pre swansea press conference
what a game this is in the premier league relegation scrap - sizzling .
author: Ian Stringer
BBC Radio Leicester Foxes commentator

documents.title: kids get a taste of university life
text: they look a bit young to be talking about going to university do n't they ?
apparently they 're not
this group of primary school students in leicester swapped the playground for a university campus yesterday to get a taste of university life .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: latest leicestershire headlines
text: latest leicestershire headlines
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tigers ' mauling still hurts 'big time '
text: captain tom youngs has said leicester must continue to learn from last month 's record european defeat against glasgow , to ensure it never happens again .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: rugby : tigers to name team
text: who 's going to be in ?
who 's going to be out ?
leicester tigers v gloucester team news will be announced at lunchtime .
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: your photos : light snow falling
text: a sprinkling of snow in melton mowbray
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: cars stolen for parts
text: andrew stafford thinks the vehicles were stolen for parts - he said : `` they 'll take the doors off , they 'll take the roof , the bonnet , the side panels , anything that 's easily removable and they 'll sell them on . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: farmer suffers repeated vehicle theft
text: andrew stafford runs a dairy farm in saxelby- he 's had six land rover defender 's stolen in 20 years .
he said it happens roughly every four years .
he told bbc radio leicester the problem is they are `` very easy to steal '' .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: more insurance claims for defender thefts
text: the amount of land rover defender thefts has increased significantly according to figures by nfu mutual .
the insurer said that in the east midlands there was a claim for a stolen defender every month in 2016 - 44 in total .
that 's a 42 % increase on 2015 claims .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rise in land rover thefts
text: in january 2016 the production of this car came to an end
the land rover defender has been driven by the queen and by james bond but probably more frequently it 's driven by farmers .
however they 're having a problem - a significant amount are being stolen in the east midlands .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: ashworth mp tweets of hunt 's 'hollow words '
text: the health secretary jeremy hunt has conceded the nhs in england is facing `` completely unacceptable '' problems .
shadow health secretary and leicester mp jon ashworth has responded with this tweet
jeremy hunt on state of nhs 'completely unacceptable . '
but its happening on his watch , he 's responsible .
just hollow words with no solutions
@ twitterid wrote correctly about this in 2013 : abdicating state responsibility for health is policy .
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid removing legal responsibility was part of their endgame-privatisation
i want you to prosecute @ twitterid @ twitterid & @ twitterid for causing this mess with their policies
@ twitterid `` happened on his watch '' ?
he purposely engineered it !
watch as the # trumpwhore sells our nhs to the usa
@ twitterid weird how he said nowt until just before a recess just like last time
it 's just the next stage of his privatisation plan so where is the opposition ?
maybe each week during # pmqs @ twitterid could give an update as to size & number of nhs contracts given to private sector
the standard answer to that is : `` these are local decisions '' = > more fobbing off responsibility .
@ twitterid any employee in a business performing with such reckless ineptitude would have been summarily dismissed long ago .
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid think u mean wd have gone through disciplinary proceedings and then left ?
sacked more like .
such deep and sustained incompetence is a sackable offence .
@ jonashworth @ twitterid only explanation he 's still in his job is because he 's following his orders .
govt want the nhs to fail .
how can nhs staff have any confidence in the health sec when he blames them for his underfunding , cuts and staff shortages ?
but the tories say it 's labour 's recklessness in charge under blair/brown ?
the tories would n't lie would they ?
crucial we lay out how we 'd put things right .
nhs only safe in our hands after all
you + @ twitterid + lab in wales need to point out much more the proper increase lab gave to the nhs from 2001-2010
+ that its down to tory cuts to the welsh grant in why the nhs there is falling behind .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: jack adcock hospital employs dedicated sepsis team
text: a specialist team dedicated to tackling sepsis has been created at leicester royal infirmary , where six-year-old jack adcock died from the condition .
he suffered a fatal cardiac arrest caused by sepsis when staff failed to correctly diagnose him .
the condition , a serious complication of an infection , kills about 37,000 people a year in england .
the team , believed to be a first in this country , will assist emergency staff .
author: Neil Heath
BBC News Online

documents.title: east midlands weather forecast
text: east midlands weather forecast
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: leicester mercury news
text: today 's front page - read the headline story here .
author: Leicester Mercury

documents.title: vote on whether foxes will go down
text: eight months after celebrating a premier league title win that ranks among the greatest of all sporting achievements , leicester find themselves firmly mired in a relegation battle .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: foxes speak to media
text: claudio ranieri is due to hold his pre-swansea press conference today - all the key quotes and headlines on local live from 09:30 .
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live news coverage
text: happy friday leicestershire - i 'll be writing the updates on your local live page today with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel .
if you 'd like to comment on any of the day 's stories you can send an email or use facebook or twitter .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live
